msContents.summary: Fragment of an Abbasid Qur'ān probably written in the fourth or fifth century H. / tenth or eleventh century C.E, containing verses 133-286 from Sura al-Baqara (سورة البقرة) and verses 1-128 from Sura Āl ʿImrān (سورة آل عمران).

msItem.title: al-Qurʼān
القرآن
Qurʼān ii:133-iii:128 of Sura al-Baqara (سورة البقرة)
Sura Āl ʿImrān: two hundred verses (آل عمران مائتا اية) [line 8]

handNote.p: The script seems to correspond to the Abbasid Style NS I as described by François Deroche.

origin.origDate: 10th or 11th century AD /4th or 5th century Hijri

history.provenance: Bought from Professor E.H. Palmer Palmer, Edward Henry, 1840-1882 and E.E. Tyrwhitt Drake Tyrwhitt Drake, E.E. in 1878.

recordHist.source: "Manuscript description based on E. G. Browne: A hand-list of the Muhammadan manuscripts, including all those written in the Arabic character, preserved in the Library of the University of Cambridge. Cambridge, 1900", enriched by staff of the Middle Eastern Department at Cambridge University Library.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions. Contact near_eastern@lib.cam.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript

monogr.title: A hand-list of the Muḥammadan manuscripts: including all those written in the Arabic character, preserved in the library of the University of Cambridge
The Abbasid tradition: Qurʼans of the 8th to the 10th centuries AD

imprint.publisher: The Nour Foundation in association with Azimuth Editions and Oxford University Press

series.title: The Nasser D. Khalili Collection of Islamic Art
